messages.subject: Re: Faeries
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 09/21/2001 6:05:10 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... I ve never really sold them, but mostly made them for gifts. They re made out of pipe
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 09/21/2001 6:05:10 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> My little Marsie adores fairies. I would very much be interested in buying
> some from you. Could you tell me a little about what you make?
>
>
I've never really sold them, but mostly made them for gifts. They're made out
of pipe cleaners (so they bend), a wooden bead, felt, floss, and silk
flowers. Sometimes an acorn cap for a hat, sometimes they have wings. They're
cute little things, about 1 1/2 to 2 inches tall.

How old is Marsie? It might even be something you could make with her if I
can figure out how to write out the instructions without your seeing one.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
